metadata.title: CVE-2019-6988 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) inopj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile inopenjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
